incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are currently observing the results.
We have identified an issue in the Subscription -> Organization section. The root cause has been determined, and we are currently preparing a fix to resolve the situation.
This incident has been resolved

A fix has been implemented and we are currently monitoring the environment. 

Further updates will be provided within the next hour.

We are currently investigating an issue where some pages might not be loading properly with timeout error. More specifically "Organization" page.

Scenario executions is not affected.

We will provide an update within the next hour.
The incident has been resolved.
A fix has been applied to the faulty scenarios and we are monitoring the zone.

We have identified the issue and we are gradually applying the fix on the scenarios with execution problems.
Further updates will be provided within the next hour.

We have identified an issue in zone us1.make.celonis.com where, due to the incident on 11.08.2024, a few scenarios got stuck in different status, affecting their schedules and executions. Our engineers are currently investigating the cause. We will provide an update within the next hour.
This incident has been resolved. We have re-enabled 26 scenarios that were affected/disabled by this incident.

As per the last update, the platform on us1.make.celonis.com has been stable. However, we did identify that certain scenarios were deactivated as a side effect of this incident. We will proceed with re-enabling them from our end. Thank you for your understanding.
We have implemented a fix, and scenario executions are now fully functional. We will continue to monitor the situation for some time.
We are still actively working on the fix, unfortunately, scenario executions are currently affected.
We have identified the potential source of the problem and are working towards implementing the fix.
We are still investigating the issue. Users of us1.make.celonis.com may experience delays in scenario executions.
We are currently experiencing an issue with scenario processing in our us1.make.celonis.com zone. We are actively investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.

Dear Users,

We would like to inform you about an outage that occurred earlier today, causing downtime for scenario executions and webhook functionality for approximately 15 minutes (between 17:10 and 17:25 CEST) in the eu1.make.com zone. The platform is now fully stable. The issue was caused by an unexpected problem with a third-party queuing tool, which encountered hardware-related difficulties. We will continue to monitor the situation closely for the next hour.

Thank you for your understanding.

incidents.name: Problems executing scenarios with Gmail app

incident_updates.body:
This incident is now resolved. 
Important note: we have re-enabled all the deactivated scenarios affected by this incident.
A fix has been implemented, and the platform is fully operational for all Make zones. We will be monitoring the situation for the next 2 hours.
The issue has been identified within the Gmail app, and we are working on the fix.

We’re investigating an issue with the Gmail app that is causing scenarios that use this app to fail. This issue impacts all Make zones. Scenarios that don’t use the Gmail app are not affected. We will update this Statuspage within the next hour, or as more information comes to hand.

We had an incident in the zone us1.make.celonis.com where it was not possible to add new modules to scenarios and effectively create new scenarios. Our engineers have identified the problem and applied the fix.

The issue has now been resolved by the Meta team.
As part of their investigations, the Meta team has identified missed leads and will begin backfilling them. We have emailed all impacted Make users with an update and will now close this issue

The Meta team is continuing to work on this issue as a top priority. We are closely tracking progress with them. We have also emailed all impacted Make users with further advice and suggested workarounds.

We’re aware of an issue affecting the “Facebook Lead Ads - New Lead” module. Users of this module may experience that some new leads are not being sent. We have partnered with Meta to identify the issue, and they are working on a resolution. We are in close contact with them to fix it as quickly as possible. We're sorry for any disruption this causes, and will keep you updated here.
This incident has been resolved

A fix have been implemented and we are monitoring the zone.

We'll provide another update within 1 hour
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Our engineers are currently investigating an issue where the web access to the platform can be unstable.

There is no impact on the execution of the scenarios

We will provide an update within the next hour.
This incident has been resolved
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
The affected zone is stable and we are monitoring the environment.

We are still investigating the cause of the timeouts.

More updates will be provided in 1 hour.

Our engineers are still working on finding the root cause of the timeouts.

We will provide more updates in 1 hour.

We are experiencing slower performance with our file system. 
This is affecting a small number of scenarios that use Webhooks, causing them to have trouble and possibly fail. Our team is looking into the issue and working to fix it as soon as possible. We will keep you updated.

We will provide more updates within one hour.

incidents.name: Error to login on the platform

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
This incident has been resolved
The situation has been stabilized and our engineers are currently monitoring the zone.

The zone is accessible to login again. But we are still investigating scenario connection errors and Webhooks functionality that is not working properly.

We will provide more updates in 1 hour.

We are currently investigating an issue in eu1.make.com where it's not possible to login to the platform.

We will provide an update within the next hour.

incidents.name: Delays on webhooks response and scenario execution

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The fix was applied and we are currently monitoring the zone.
Our engineers are still working on the fix. We will provide more updates within the next hour.

The root cause was identified by our engineers and we are currently applying the fix. 

We will provide further updates within the next hour.
We are currently investigating an issue where some users can experience delays in Scenario executions and Webhook responses.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified set of scenarios which got disabled due to this incident and we will proceed with activating them again.
We have applied a fix and the situation is stable. We will keep monitoring the situation.
We have identified a root cause and working on a fix.
We are experiencing delays in scenario execution in EU2 and US1 zones. We also observe issues with some scheduled scenarios (mainly with Gmail or RSS triggers).

incidents.name: EU1 enterprise zone - problems with scenario and webhook processing

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We're encountering issues executing scenarios and acception webhooks on eu1.make.celonis.com. Users may experience delays and errors when attempting to execute any scenarios.  We're currently investigating this issue and will update this Statuspage within the next hour, or as more information comes to hand.

incidents.name: Errors to login on the platform

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified the issue and implemented a fix. Login to us1.make.com is now fully functional. We will be monitoring the situation for the next 1-2 hours to ensure everything is fine.

We are currently investigating an issue where is not possible to login to us1.make.com

We will provide an update within the next hour.

incidents.name: Long response time on webhook services

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring us1.make.com zone. 

Further updates will be provided in the next hour.

We are currently investigating an issue in one of our us1.make.com zone that is causing delays on webhook responses.

We will provide further updates within in the next hour.

incidents.name: Login to make zones is not functional

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently experiencing login issues affecting all production zones. Scenario executions and webhook processing are not impacted. Our team is actively investigating the problem and working towards a resolution. We will provide updates in the next 30 minutes.

We are currently experiencing login issues affecting all production zones. Scenario executions and webhook processing are not impacted. Our team is actively investigating the problem and working towards a resolution. We will provide updates in the next 30 minutes.

incidents.name: DB performance issues on us1.make.com and eu1.make.com

incident_updates.body:
Dear Users,

We are providing this retrospective update regarding an issue that occurred today between 13:00 and 14:00 UTC. During this time, you may have experienced instability with our platform in the US1 and EU1 regions.

We have identified the cause of the issue within our database, and the functionality of our platform is now fully operational.

Thank you for your understanding!
This incident has been resolved. Email notifications are now processed without any delay.

We have implemented the fix and are currently significantly reducing the number of delayed emails. We expect the whole queue to be drained within the next 1 or 2 hours, after which we will provide an update.
We have identified the issue and are working on implementing the fix. We will provide a new update within the next 2 hours.

We are currently investigating an issue where emails notifications can be delivered with a delay.

We will post updates within the next hour.
This inciden has been resolved.
The issue affecting us1.make.com has been resolved. We will continue to monitor the situation for any potential issues. Currently, the platform is fully operational.
We are currently still investigating the issue, which appears to be experiencing intermittent disruptions. We expect to provide an update within the next hour.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We're currently investigating an issue within the us1.make.com zone where certain scenarios are experiencing timeouts.

Further updates will be provided within the next hour.
The zone is now stable and we haven't observed any issues.
The current situation has become stable. We're continuously monitoring the environment and we will provide an update in then next 2 hours
We are currently looking into a technical problem that could lead to decreased performance in the eu2.make.com zone. Our telemetry indicates potential delays in webhook processing.
This incident has been resolved. All webhooks are fully functional.
The implemented fix is functional, and the delay in webhook response is significantly lower. We will continue to monitor the situation for the next few hours.
We have identified the issue and implemented a fix. Currently, we are monitoring the progress. The delay in processing should be decreasing, and we are closely observing the situation.

Users in the US1 zone are experiencing issues with shared webhooks, resulting in delays or failed deliveries. Additionally, there are delays in processing all webhooks within the US1 zone.

We are investigating the issues and will provide an update within the next hour.
Incoming shared webhooks on US1 are currently being dropped and our team is looking into the issue. We will share the update in the next hour.
The issue has been addressed and webhooks are fully operations without any delays.
Situation stable, actively monitoring zone to ensure continued control.

We are currently investigating a technical issue that may result in reduced performance of the us1.make.com zone. Based on our telemetry, webhook processing may be delayed. The issue started approximately at 18:30 UTC.
This incident got resolved. We identified the root cause and working on a fix.
The situation remains stable, and we are actively monitoring the zone. We will continue to keep a close watch to ensure that everything remains under control.
We encountered technical difficulties with webhooks on us1.make.com between 04:00 - 06:30 UTC. As a result, users may experience delays in the processing of webhooks during this period.

incidents.name: Login not functional US1 and EU2

incident_updates.body: The incident has been resolved. Login pages are back to normal operation.
A fix has been implemented. We are monitoring the results.
We have identified the root cause and we are proactively applying a fix.
We are currently investigating an issue related to non-functioning Login pages for both US1 and EU2 zones. We apologize for the inconvenience. We will come with updates in the next 30 minutes.
This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been successfully implemented, and the issue regarding delayed webhook processing on the eu2.make.com zone has been mitigated. Our team will continue to closely monitor the situation to ensure stability. Thank you for your patience and understanding.
We are currently facing an issue with delayed webhook processing on eu2.make.com zone. We are actively working on mitigating the situation. An update will be provided within the next 60 minutes.

We are still in contact with our third-party provider to gather more information and prevent this issue from happening again. Meanwhile, the workaround that was implemented has been working as expected. The incident has been resolved.

We have successfully implemented a workaround, and the content of the affected pages is now accessible. However, we are still awaiting a response from the third-party service and further insight into the issue. Currently, the entire webpage is operational. We will continue to monitor the situation closely until we receive additional information from the third party.

We are still investigating the issue, and our initial suspicion is that it may be related to one of our third-party services. We anticipate providing the next update within the next 2 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our Help and API documentation websites are currently unreachable due to unknown reasons. We are currently investigating the root cause. The rest of the platform's functionalities are unaffected. We will provide an update in the next 30 minutes. Sorry for the inconvenience.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We're encountering issues executing scenarios on eu2.make.com. Users may experience delays and errors when attempting to execute any scenarios. There are no other issues with scenario creation or general connectivity to Make. We're currently investigating this issue and will update this Statuspage within the next hour, or as more information comes to hand.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

We have identified and resolved the issue associated with the recent code change. Stability has been restored to eu2.make.com since 14:20 CET. We will continue to monitor the situation for the next several hours.

We are currently experiencing issues with the eu2.make.com zone. Login to the webpage is unreachable, and scenario executions are affected. We are actively investigating the issue and will provide an update within the next 60 minutes.
This incident has been resolved.
The fix has been successfully rolled out. Webhooks and mailhooks should now be fully functional for eu1.make.com. We will continue to monitor the situation for the next few hours.

While monitoring the issue, we observed certain problems with mailhooks and webhooks. We have identified the issue and are working on rolling out the fix. The issue pertains only to eu1.make.com, the remaining zones are functional.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the current behavior.

We are currently experiencing issues with some of our services responsible for shared hooks on our clusters.
Shared hooks might currently be unresponsive. We are actively investigating the issue.
We have reactivated the affected scenarios. Please note that this reactivation will not be visible in the scenario logs. Currently, the Monday app is fully operational.
A fix has been rolled and we are investigating options to re-enable affected scenarios automatically.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

The queue of messages has been fully processed and the system has returned back to normal operation. Shared hooks are now delivered without delays. We will now continue to monitor the systems and ensure that there is no regression.

We have implemented and validated a solution to the underlying problem. The queue of hooks is now being processed at an accelerated pace and we expect to return to normal operation in the following 90 minutes. The average hook processing delay is approximately 3 hours.

We have taken the necessary steps to stabilize the situation and started processing the queue of hooks at a faster pace. The main issue still persists and shared hooks are currently being processed with a significant delay.
Our engineers are currently pursuing two hypotheses with the goal to remediate the issue. We will post another update latest in an hour.
The issue still persists and shared hooks are being processed with a delay. The team is working towards addressing the root cause of the issue.
We have identified the issue and applied a fix. Currently shared hooks are responding but might be delayed.

We are currently experiencing issues with some of our services responsible for shared hooks on our clusters.
Shared hooks might currently be unresponsive. We are actively investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Delay in scenario executions on eu1.make.celonis.com

incident_updates.body: The platform remains stable. The root cause has been identified, and we will actively work on the matter to prevent future reoccurrences.

We have identified delays in scenario executions due to intermittent network issues affecting communication between our platform and one of our third-party services. We are actively working with the provider to investigate this and will share more information as soon as it becomes available.
The zone is currently stable. Scenario execution duration times are back to normal. We are still investigating the culprit.
We are currently experiencing issues with increased scenario execution and webhook response times. We are actively investigating the issue and we will provide an update within the next 15 minutes.
The implemented workaround has been effective and eu1.make.celonis.com remains stable. The incident has been resolved.
The situation stays stable. We are still investigating the root cause of the problem. We will maintain ongoing monitoring and notify once we fully resolve the incident.

The tuning of our Data Store infrastructure did relieve the situation and Scenarios using the Data Store App are stable again. We are continuously monitoring the state of our platform. We will come up with an update in the next 30 minutes. Thank you for your understanding and patience.

We are still investigating the root cause of this incident. Meanwhile, we are tuning our Data Store infrastructure to relieve the situation and put the platform in a more stable state. We will come up with an update in the next 30 minutes. Thank you for your understanding and patience.

We have detected multiple instances of the Datastore App timing out and failing on eu1.make.celonis.com. We are currently investigating the root cause and will come back to you once we find more information. Thank you for your understanding and patience.

incidents.name: Intermittent scenario execution errors in eu1, eu2 and us1 zones

incident_updates.body: Due to a configuration error, some scenarios in the eu1.make.com, eu2.make.com and us1.make.com zones may have intermittently failed to execute and in case of multiple consecutive errors get disabled by the system. According to our telemetry, the number of impacted scenarios was very small. Customers may have experienced this behavior between 9:45am and 8:00pm CET. We have addressed the configuration problem and all executions are now stable. We will continue monitoring the situation.
This incident has been resolved.

The current situation is stable, and after performing a series of checks, no issues were observed. We will maintain ongoing monitoring for the next 4 hours, and if everything remains stable during this period, we will proceed to resolve the incident.
The issue is currently stable. We will continue careful monitoring of the situation and provide updates regularly.

Our team is continuing to investigate the technical difficulties affecting webhooks and mailhooks on eu2.make.com. At this time, we have not yet identified the root cause, and users may still experience sporadic delays in the processing of these services.

We are currently experiencing technical difficulties with webhooks and mailhooks on eu2.make.com. Users may encounter delays in the processing of webhooks and mailhooks.
We will provide another update on this Statuspage within the next 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
This incident has been resolved.
We have noticed a degradation of performance on eu1.make.celonis.com. A fix has been applied and the system is fully operational again.

incidents.name: Users cannot clone nor move scenarios

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We implemented workaround and we are currently monitoring the issue.

We are experiencing issues within our scenario features i.e. users cannot clone scenario nor move it to a folder inside list of scenarios. This is still possible when user open particular scenario.
We are currently working on implementing a quick workaround, we should publish the relevant steps within the next 30 minutes.
This incident has been resolved.
We have identified that cause of the issue, users should no longer experience unexpected session drops. We will be monitoring the situation for the next few hours.

We encountered issues related to user sessions, so users may experience that their session might be disconnected after a few minutes. We are currently investigating the issue and we will provide a new update in the next hour.
This incident has been resolved.

We have now contacted all customers that were affected by the Data Store issue. We will continue working with them directly to fix any discrepancies that have arisen in their Data Stores. If we have not contacted you, you were not impacted by the issue.

We have now completed our investigation and identified that the issue affected a small percentage of Make users and their organizations. We are preparing to update all impacted customers with information about the scenarios and particular executions that may have produced incorrect data in the Data Store. We expect to update all impacted customers in the next 24 hours.

We have confirmed that this issue did not impact private and OEM instances. We are currently working to identify all affected customers in Make multi-tenant zones (eu1.make.com, eu2.make.com, eu1.make.celonis.com, us1.make.com, us1.make.celonis.com). Once we have identified these customers, we will contact them and post an update here to explain the issue and any ongoing impact. We will share the next update as soon as we can.
We are currently in the process of locating impacted scenarios. Once the full list is obtained further communications will be sent.

We have identified an issue with the "Update a Record" module in the Data store app. In the period of September 18th 7:16pm CET until September 19th 12:00pm, the module might have produced incorrect output and data store records that were updated during this period may have been incorrectly stored (only the updated values for a given record were stored while other values were cleared). We are investigating the scope of impact and will provide more information in the next update.
The issue has been identified and a fix has been implemented. We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time.

"We have detected an issue specifically with the 'Update a Record' module in the datastore app. For the time being, we kindly request that you refrain from using scenarios associated with this module until the matter is resolved. Thank you for your understanding and patience."

incidents.name: delayed webhook response time on eu1.make.com

incident_updates.body: The incident has been resolved.
A fix was applied and webhook response time is back at expected level. We are closely monitoring the situation.
Webhook response time might be delayed on eu1.make.com. Our team is currently investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Delayed scenario executions in the EU1 zone

incident_updates.body: Executions of scheduled scenarios in the EU1 zone are delayed.

incidents.name: Issues with Facebook Lead Ads - New Event instant trigger

incident_updates.body: This incident was resolved by hotfix.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.

We have applied the fix to reactivate the affected scenarios. 
Please note that this reactivation will not be visible in the scenario logs.
Currently the platfrom is fully operational but we will continue to monitor situation for the next couple of hours.

The issue has been identified and we are currently working on implementing the fix to reactivate the affected scenarios.
We'll post the next update once the fix is rolled out.

We have identified the cause of the issue. Any newly executed scenarios and scheduled scenarios should work correctly. However, as part of the investigation we noticed the issue affected other zones: us1.make.com and eu2.make.com. 
We are currently working on reactivating the affected scenarios.

We are facing issues with scenario execution affecting users on eu1.make.com. Scenarios might unexpectedly fail, users might receive notification about scenarios being stopped, We are currently investigating the cause of the issue, we will provide more details within the next hour.

incidents.name: Scenarios using Custom Variables not working properly

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved.
We have applied a permanent fix on eu1.make.celonis.com and eu1.make.com, and based on our checks there are no issues and all scenarios are running as expected.
We are applying a fix for this issue.

We have applied a permanent fix on us1.make.celonis.com and us1.make.com, and based on our checks there are no issues and all scenarios are running as expected.

In regards to eu1.make.celonis.com and eu1.make.com, we are going to roll out the fix outside of business hours. 
Please use the workaround as needed, it was described in the previous update.

We will post another update once a full fix is applied.

We're currently experiencing an issue that appears only in certain unique circumstances when a running scenario is not properly using the values of team or organization variables during executions.

Specific circumstances for the issue are:
- A team or organization variable is used as a filter condition OR there is more than one team or organization variable referenced within a single mapped field, OR the variable is used inside a function.
- AND the scenario was created / modified before March 8, 2023 
- AND the execution occurs after May 3, 2023

Workaround: 
Any user encountering this issue can open the affected scenario, make any change (move a module) and hit save. This will immediately resolve the issue for that scenario.

Complete resolution: 
The development team is actively working on a fix that will address any scenario where the issue still persists. Will post an update once we have more information around the permanent fix.
We're currently experiencing issues with Scenarios that use Custom Variables. Our engineering team is investigating the root cause.
Users might have experienced problems using web UI, login was not available between 10:45 and 11:10 CEST. The issue was resolved, all systems are now operational.

While we still await details from Twitter the only way how to create a connection at this moment is to have every user to create their own Twitter app at developer.twitter.com and use the apps API Key and API Key Secret to create a new connection in Make. We updated our documentation with details about how to obtain API Key and API Key Secret - https://www.make.com/en/help/apps/marketing/twitter#obtaining-api-key-and-api-key-secret-values-for-your-twitter-account
Twitter has suspended our app. We are continuing to investigate.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Increased delay in scenarios executions for users on eu1.make.com since 10:00 CET

incident_updates.body: The issue was resolved.
Scenario processing is stable now. We are closely monitoring the situation.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Issue was resolved and platform is fully operational.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Website performance may be degraded and API requests are timing out. Users may not be able to use the web interface to manage their organizations and scenarios. The team is currently investigating the root cause of the issue.
